metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11041 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When PHP EXIF extension is parsing EXIF information from an image, e.g. via exif_read_data() function, in PHP versions 7.1.x below 7.1.31, 7.2.x below 7.2.21 and 7.3.x below 7.3.8 it is possible to supply it with data what will cause it to read past the allocated buffer. This may lead to information disclosure or crash.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11041` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.2 - 7.2.19-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
libphp7.2-embed - 7.2.19-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
php7.2 - 7.2.19-0ubuntu0.18.04.2

notes.Note: sbeattie> PEAR issues should go against php-pear as of xenial leosilva> for php5 backports: https://github.com/Microsoft/php-src/

criterions.comment: php7.2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.2.19-0ubuntu0.18.04.2').
